intro: Glicophyllum selerianum, commonly known as the Selerian gum tree, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and showy, pink or white flowers. The plant produces a unique, sticky gum that has been used traditionally in various applications. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in coastal areas and disturbed soils. The leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a rough texture, contributing to its ecological role in supporting local biodiversity.
